summary: An email from attorney Suzanne Jaffe Bloom to an unspecified recipient (likely a client or witness) regarding a grand jury subpoena from the SDNY. The email confirms legal representation, proposes a meeting, and notes an adjournment of a scheduled appearance date.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.context: Attorney sending an email to confirm legal representation in connection with a grand jury subpoena, schedule a meeting, and confirm an adjournment of an appearance date.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the grand jury subpoena matter, likely another attorney or staff member involved.

connections.description: Both are involved in the same legal matter regarding a grand jury subpoena, with Hudgens copied on the correspondence.

events.title: SDNY Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Adjourned Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: A scheduled grand jury appearance date was adjourned, so no appearance was required on that date.

events.title: Proposed Meeting
events.description: A meeting was proposed between the attorney and the recipient to discuss the grand jury subpoena matter.

keyFacts: Attorney Suzanne Jaffe Bloom was formally retained to represent a client or witness in connection with an SDNY grand jury subpoena dated July 5, 2019.
A grand jury appearance scheduled for July 24, 2019, was adjourned, indicating ongoing legal proceedings.
The email proposes a meeting on July 29, 2019, to discuss the matter, showing active legal coordination.
The correspondence is privileged and confidential, highlighting the sensitive nature of the grand jury investigation.
